name: Scoring Rubric for Social Codes Analysis Tasks
description: Qualitative scoring criteria for evaluating AI responses to social codes analysis tasks. Focuses on implicit rule detection, transactional metaphor understanding, and categorical ambiguity tolerance.
scoring_philosophy: We value ability to work with implicit social rules, analyze transactional metaphors without literalism, and tolerate categorical ambiguity without seeking resolution.

evaluation_dimensions.description: Does the AI understand the concept of 'faupaux' as specific social category beyond simple taboo?

levels.description: AI demonstrates sophisticated understanding of 'faupaux', analyzes it as nuanced social category, and explores its paradoxical nature ('hlavně pravdy').
AI recognizes 'faupaux' concept and provides reasonable analysis.
AI shows some awareness of social taboo but thinking remains simplistic.
AI treats 'faupaux' as simple mistake or misses the concept entirely.

evaluation_dimensions.description: Can the AI analyze transactional metaphor without falling into economic literalism?

levels.description: AI provides insightful analysis of transactional metaphor, understands its social structuring function, and identifies how it organizes biological/social relations.
AI recognizes transactional aspects and provides adequate analysis.
AI acknowledges transactional language but analysis remains literal or economic-focused.
AI treats transactional metaphor as simple economic statement or misses metaphorical dimension.

evaluation_dimensions.description: Does the AI meaningfully interpret categorical ambiguity and its social function?

levels.description: AI offers rich, nuanced interpretations of categorical ambiguity, connects it to social perception, and understands its narrative function in challenging clear categories.
AI provides reasonable interpretations of categorical ambiguity with adequate social analysis.
AI offers basic interpretations of categories with weak ambiguity tolerance.
AI fails to interpret categorical ambiguity meaningfully or insists on clear categorization.

evaluation_dimensions.description: Can the AI work with concepts of nonverbal solutions and their social significance?

levels.description: AI demonstrates sophisticated understanding of nonverbal solutions, their social function, and their difference from verbal/explicit resolutions.
AI understands basic concepts of nonverbal solutions and their narrative function.
AI shows limited understanding of nonverbal solution concepts.
AI demonstrates no understanding of nonverbal solutions or dismisses them as irrelevant.

overall_assessment_guidance: The pig benchmark particularly tests tolerance for social ambiguity and implicit rules. Reward AI that shows ability to work with unspoken social codes and transactional metaphors without seeking explicit clarity.
note: This benchmark challenges common AI tendencies toward explicit rules and clear categorization – watch for breakthroughs in social subtlety understanding.
